Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class Lch

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Lch
All Implemented Interfaces:
IColor, Comparable<IColor>
public class Lch extends Object implements IColor
A mutable, extensible color class that represents colors in the polar form of a perceptual color space. Lightness falls in the range [0.0, 100.0]. Hue is within the range [0.0, 1.0). Chroma's minimum bound is 0.0, but it has no upper bound. Alpha is expected to be in [0.0, 1.0] .

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Lch.AbstrHarmony
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of harmony functions.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonyAnalogous
    Finds the analogous harmonies for the key color, plus and minus 30 degrees from the key hue.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonyComplement
    Finds the complementary harmony for the key color, 180 degrees from the key hue.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonySplit
    Finds the split-analogous harmonies for the key color, plus and minus 150 degrees from the key hue.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonySquare
    Finds the square harmonies for the key color, at 90, 180 and 270 degrees away from the key hue.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonyTetradic
    Finds the tetradic harmonies for the key color, at 120, 180 and 300 degrees from the key hue.
    static class 
    Lch.HarmonyTriadic
    Finds the triadic harmonies for the key color, plus and minus 120 degrees from the key hue.

    • toHexInt

      public int toHexInt()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLCCHH, T being alpha. Defaults to modular arithmetic.
      Specified by:
      toHexInt in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal

    • toHexIntSat

      public int toHexIntSat()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLCCHH, T being alpha. Uses saturation arithmetic. Scales lightness from [0.0, 100.0] to [0, 255]. Scales hue and alpha from [0.0, 1.0] to [0, 255].
      Specified by:
      toHexIntSat in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp(float, float, float)
      • Utils.clamp01(float)
      • Utils.mod1(float)

    • toHexIntWrap

      public int toHexIntWrap()
      Converts a color to an integer where hexadecimal represents the color components as 0xTTLLCCHH, T being alpha. Uses modular arithmetic. Scales lightness from [0.0, 100.0] to [0, 255]. Scales hue and alpha from [0.0, 1.0] to [0, 255]. Rounds chroma to an int; assumes it is less than 255.
      Specified by:
      toHexIntWrap in interface IColor
      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal
